subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] How to handle "er" and "ur" in QS
msgSnippet: ... I ll have to have a look at this, but off the top of my head, I don t know if we should necessarily feel stuck just because Read s original intent was
messageBody:
John Cowan wrote:
>
>
> oliver langan scripsit:
>
> > I agree the 'ir' sound in bird sounds a little different than of the
> > 'ar' in arena (when I say them).
>
> Utter+Roe is an entirely artificial way of writing the words in the
> NURSE set, but Read prescribes it, so we are stuck with it. Shavian
> IMHO was better here: you can see the "plus R" in some of the letters if
> you look, but effectively Err is a separate letter, distinct from
> Up+Roar, that has its own sound, and quite distinct from Array.
>

I'll have to have a look at this, but off the top of my head, I don't
know if we should necessarily feel stuck just because Read's original
intent was inadequate. It may be too hard to insert a letter, but if we
could and needed to, we might consider it. We shouldn't revere Read's as
if he were a Saint and his intentions are beyond question. (I'm not
saying you yourself do this.)

Paul

>  > I agree the 'ir' sound in bird sounds a little different than of the
>  > 'ar' in arena (when I say them).
> 
> Utter+Roe is an entirely artificial way of writing the words in the
> NURSE set, but Read prescribes it, so we are stuck with it. Shavian
> IMHO was better here: you can see the "plus R" in some of the letters if
> you look, but effectively Err is a separate letter, distinct from
> Up+Roar, that has its own sound, and quite distinct from Array.

I'll have to have a look at this, but off the top of my head, I don't 
know if we should necessarily feel stuck just because Read's original 
intent was inadequate. It may be too hard to insert a letter, but if we 
could and needed to, we might consider it. We shouldn't revere Read's as 
if he were a Saint and his intentions are beyond question. (I'm not 
saying you yourself do this.)
